channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: The virus hunters who search bat caves to predict the next pandemic
item.description: Before entering the cave, the small team of scientists pull on hazmat suits, face masks and thick gloves to cover every inch of their skin. Contact with bat droppings or urine could expose them to some of the world's deadliest unknown viruses.

item.title: Trump is driving Birx's balancing act to the limit
CNN anchor: We have to report this, even though it's insane
item.description: CNN's Brian Stelter examines life during the coronavirus pandemic and how people in positions of power are handling it.

item.title: Almost all of Germany now required to wear masks. Loosening lockdowns in Europe.
Boris Johnson warns against relaxing UK lockdown as he returns to work after battle with coronavirus
item.description: Boris Johnson has warned against relaxing the United Kingdom's coronavirus restrictions too soon in his first remarks since returning to work after contracting the disease.

item.title: 'The food supply chain is breaking,' Tyson Foods says as plants close
item.description: Tyson Foods is warning that "millions of pounds of meat" will disappear from the supply chain as the coronavirus pandemic pushes food processing plants to close, leading to product shortages in grocery stores across the country.

item.title: Amid mounting speculation, South Korea says Kim Jong Un is 'alive and well'
item.description: South Korea continued to pour water on mounting speculation about the health of North Korea's leader Kim Jong Un, telling CNN he is "alive and well."

item.title: New satellite images show Kim Jong Un's compound
item.description: Newly released satellite images show Kim Jong Un's compound in Wonsan, North Korea, as questions circulate about the state of the North Korean leader's health. CNN's Will Ripley reports.

item.title: Fauci's 'SNL' dream becomes Trump's nightmare
item.description: It must have been a nightmare for President Donald Trump. In early April, Dr. Anthony Fauci was jokingly asked on CNN's "New Day" who he would want to play him on "Saturday Night Live." A laughing Fauci responded, "Brad Pitt, of course." On Saturday the infectious disease specialist had his wish come true as "SNL" opened its show with the actor -- twice named by People magazine as "sexiest man alive" -- playing the 79-year-old doctor.

item.title: People crowd Southern California beaches despite coronavirus concerns
New York hospitals are studying a common heartburn drug as treatment for Covid-19
item.description: Hospitals in New York are giving Covid-19 patients heartburn medicine to see if it helps fight the virus, according to the doctor who initiated the trial.

item.title: Tapper: Trump's musings were there for all to see and hear
item.description: CNN's Jake Tapper gives his take on President Donald Trump's dangerous suggestion during one of his White House briefings that ingesting disinfectant could kill the coronavirus.

item.title: What happened when I bought a hotel by mistake
item.description: Anyone currently whiling away the long hours of lockdown with when-this-is-all-over dreams of a fresh start in life, should heed this as a cautionary tale.

item.title: Lessons in mateship as Australia lurches from one crisis to another
item.description: For one minute on Saturday, millions of people in two countries were united by silence. Australians and New Zealanders paused at dawn on April 25 to commemorate the lives lost during war.

item.title: Trump's outrageous suggestion comes with a dark history
item.description: Pandemics, even as they cause untold suffering, do more than create new problems. They reveal long-held cultural attitudes, approaches to faith in governance and differing beliefs about individual rights and trust in science. Historically speaking, these myriad responses reemerge from pandemic to pandemic in recycling patterns of seemingly historical truisms. We ignore, we deny, we blame.

item.title: Australian truck driver charged in crash that killed four police officers and left nation reeling
item.description: A truck driver in Melbourne, Australia, faced court on Monday after killing four police officers in a crash last week that sparked an outpouring of grief and anger across the country.

item.title: SpaceX Starship SN4 passes key test, Elon Musk says
item.description: A prototype of a SpaceX ship meant to one day take humans to the moon and Mars has passed a key test.

item.title: Louisiana police officer fatally shot, another critically injured in standoff with suspect
item.description: A four-hour standoff with a homicide suspect in Louisiana left one police officer dead and another critically injured, Baton Rouge Chief Murphy Paul said in a news briefing Sunday.

item.title: Preliminary results from a remdesivir trial could come in a week or two
item.description: Preliminary results from a clinical trial of remdesivir, an experimental antiviral drug being tested for coronavirus, could come in as little as one to two weeks, a top researcher said Sunday.

item.title: NASCAR driver Ryan Newman says he will return to racing after crash
item.description: NASCAR driver Ryan Newman said Sunday that he will return to racing when the season resumes after he was involved in a fiery crash during the last lap of the Daytona 500 in February.

item.title: It's basically impossible to practice social distancing in Hong Kong's cage homes
First ever 'road map' of the moon released
item.description: The US Geological Survey released the first ever comprehensive lunar map with rock layers and craters charted in great detail.

item.title: Military police launch 'extensive search' for Fort Hood soldier who hasn't been seen since Wednesday
item.description: Authorities are searching for a missing soldier stationed at Fort Hood who hasn't been seen since Wednesday.

item.title: Some scientists are using sewage to measure the prevalence of coronavirus in their communities
item.description: As the need for widespread Covid-19 testing grows, officials are looking to flush out hidden cases of the virus by examining sewage.

item.title: DACA recipients shocked to learn that ICE has access to their information
item.description: When the Trump administration announced its intention to end DACA in 2017, recipient Eliana Fernandez said she felt broken.

item.title: While billionaires isolate in luxurious Mediterranean hideaways, Paris suburbs face surge in deaths
item.description: While billionaires isolate themselves at luxurious hideaways on the Mediterranean during the coronavirus outbreak, residents in deprived and crowded areas of France are now facing a surge in deaths, along with unrest on the streets.

item.title: What happened on board the last cruise ship still at sea
item.description: In January 2020, the gigantic Costa Deliziosa cruise ship slipped its moorings in the Italian city of Venice and headed out into the Adriatic Sea on an around-the-world voyage. Around 2000 passengers were on board for what they hoped would be the trip of a lifetime.

item.title: Shop owner plans to reopen despite call from governor's office
item.description: Parts of Colorado are beginning to lift coronavirus restrictions. CNN's Gary Tuchman speaks with a local barber shop owner who plans to reopen, despite the fact that the state told him not to.

item.title: Several Italian mafia bosses released from prison over coronavirus fears
item.description: Several Italian mafia bosses have been released from prison under a new coronavirus regulation, the country's national anti-mafia prosecutor said.

item.title: What a father tells his son born during a pandemic
item.description: CNN Correspondent Bill Weir shares video of the moment his son was born and reads a letter to him about the current state of the world.

item.title: 'Homeland' zeroes in on Carrie and Saul in a tense series finale
item.description: When Showtime renewed "Homeland" through an eighth season, the three-year extension offered the prospect of a big buildup and whiz-bang finish. What emerged fell short of that, culminating in a tense, high-stakes finale that still felt like a much-diminished show from the one whose debut rightfully earned awards, critical praise and President Obama's endorsement.

item.title: Davido releases 'Dolce & Gabanna' music video and donates proceeds to coronavirus research
item.description: Nigerian singer, Davido, is doing his part in the fight against COVID-19.

item.title: Kanye West is finally a billionaire, Forbes says. He sent a text to say it undervalued him
item.description: Kanye West has long coveted the title of "billionaire."

item.title: Dr. Gupta shows Elmo how to make a mask
item.description: During the CNN Sesame Street town hall, Dr. Sanjay Gupta explains to Elmo why people are wearing masks and how to make one during the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: Why some kids are happier right now, and other unexpected effects of quarantine
item.description: Like most parents, Seagal Hagege, a mom of three in Irvine, California, wasn't exactly looking forward to sheltering in place.

item.title: Why Stacey Abrams is making her case for VP -- everywhere
item.description: Stacey Abrams is everywhere, and she's not coy about her ambitions: She wants to be Joe Biden's running mate.

item.title: Tampa mayor tries to make amends with Tom Brady in welcome letter
item.description: Tom Brady has had a few mishaps since moving to Tampa, Florida, so the mayor is trying to make nice with him.

item.title: Remember when J.Lo made Juicy Couture tracksuits cool?
item.description: Remember when Jennifer Lopez turned a kitsch tracksuit into the outfit to own in the early 2000s?

item.title: Mental health is 'a pandemic no one is talking about,' says NBA All-Star
item.description: NBA star Kevin Love keeps a Shakespeare quote in his notebook: "Things won are done, joy's soul lies in the doing."

item.title: Internet loses it over a bad tuna sandwich
item.description: Sen. Mark Warner looked to bring some levity to the public amid the coronavirus outbreak by sharing a cooking tutorial this week -- but even some of his colleagues decried his culinary choice as fishy and heavy-handed.

item.title: Angelina Jolie shares parenting advice, saying you don't have to be perfect
item.description: Award-winning actress Angelina Jolie has penned a letter to parents, offering advice during the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Rugby is in 'crisis' but this man thinks he can solve it
item.description: A plucky, abrasive presence on the rugby field, Agustin Pichot has never done things quietly -- a boldness he now carries into the game's boardrooms.

item.title: Coronavirus cases in US nearing 1 million
Trump is driving Dr. Birx's balancing act to the limit
item.description: Opinion: Dr. Birx is struggling with a nearly impossible choice

item.title: California beaches packed despite coronavirus concerns
item.description: Seeking relief from a heat wave, thousands of people crowded beaches in Southern California this weekend amid the coronavirus pandemic, despite a statewide stay-at-home order implemented by the governor last month.

item.title: You can catch virus more than once
Reviving America after Covid-19 will take years, not months
item.description: Does anyone really want a barber's fingers in their face right now?

item.title: University football recruit shot and killed
item.description: An 18-year-old University of Louisville football recruit was shot and killed in Orlando on Saturday night, police said.

item.title: Ingenious designs to fight coronavirus
item.description: Global Grad Show is a celebration of academic ingenuity billed as the "world's leading exhibition of innovative graduate design."
